title: (x) Serif face w/ ligatures in Migros annual report - DTL Fleischmann {Stephen, Mickey D}
content:
I’m mainly interested in the nice ligatures...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Migros.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123352/http:/typophile.com/files/Migros.jpg) | 47.72 KB |

 [‹ (x) Celtel logo rounded sans - Helvetica Rounded {Marten Fischer}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123352/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31512 "Go to previous forum topic") [Thick Slab Serif with sharp "blade like" protrusions! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123352/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31497 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Frau Krause

comments.content:
This is Fleishmann Medium by Dutch Type Library (very expensive- 100 a weight)

[http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/PDF/Fleischmann%20Schriftmuster.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123352/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/PDF/Fleischmann%20Schriftmuster.pdf "http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/PDF/Fleischmann%20Schriftmuster.pdf")

But for extra credit have a gander at these :-)

an equally beautiful and expensive face is Farnham:

[http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Farnham:](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123352/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Farnham: "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Farnham:")

Also have a look at Arnhem, Mercury, Freight.

Mikey ;-)
This looks like a Latin design. I already checked Dino dos Santos, Iñigo Jerez, Eduardo Manso and Mário Feliciano.

That at ligature doesn’t really work does it? What purpose does it serve?

Nick Cooke

YES! DTL of course. It seemed familiar to me, but I didn’t recognize it. I love DTL and the best: I already have parts of Fleischmann... Farnham and Arnhem are also nice – but no ligatures ...

. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

fraukrause
